column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent

#Text=Most of us have played sport all our lives , but there 's a difference between playing sport and playing sport at a high level , and the higher level you go , the more specialized you tend to become .
#Text=And here [ we 're ] looking at two exceptions to that .
#Text=I suppose that I can round that out by saying to you that I do n't think that I would ever reach the pinnacle .
#Text=I 'm not prepared to spend ten years dedicated to that one thing .
#Text=And to get that last ten per cent or five percent of performance at that level .
#Text=That 's what you 've got to do .
#Text=So I 'll play everything to a reasonable level , but to get to that really , really highest peak level you have to give up everything else .
#Text=When you go to the pub , do your mates make fun of you for having a medal in women 's blind skiing ?
#Text=No , not really .
#Text=Usually they say " I love it ! " and " This is pretty cool ! "
#Text=We started at the Olympics .
#Text=We went out into the crowd to meet Jess ' mum , and we had our medals .

#Text=There were two of us and we were waiting for her mum to come back and in that two hour period there was at least a hundred and fifty people from all over the world who wore our medals and took photographs .
#Text=My medal 's been all over Australia .
#Text=Going to a completely different issue , blind sports have three classifications , that are medical , unlike everybody else , who 've got functional ability [ classifications ] .
#Text=You 've got the only medical ones .
#Text=Do you think the blind classifications are fair in terms of how they operate ?
#Text=Or should there be changes ?
#Text=And how that works in terms of the IPC ?
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=I think the system they 've got in place is good , in terms of having the three classes .
#Text=You 've got completely blind which are B1s , less than 5 percent , which are B2 , and less than 10 percent is a B3 .
#Text=I think those systems work really well .

#Text=I guess one of the difficult things with vision impairment is that there are so many diseases and conditions that everyone 's sight is completely different , and they have that problem with the other classes as well .
#Text=But in terms of the class system itself I think having the three works really well .
#Text=What do you think ?
#Text=I think the classification system itself 's fine .
#Text=It 's the one or two grey areas , people : are they there or are they there ?
#Text=That affected you in Beijing .
#Text=Yeah .

#Text=That was obviously really disappointing , but , ironic as well in that one of my eyes is point zero one of a percent too sighted , so one 's eligible , the other 's just outside their criteria , which left me unable to compete .
#Text=Because my condition is degenerative .
#Text=They knew that my sight would get worse .
#Text=I guess I was in a fortunate position where once my sight deteriorated I was going to become eligible .
#Text=There are some of the classes , if you do n't have a degenerate condition , that 's not possible .
#Text=No one ever wants to lose their best sight , but that was one positive .
